alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued November 20 at 11:01AM AKST until November 21 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...STRONG WINTER STORM WILL BE IMPACTING THE NORTH AND CENTRAL PANHANDLE... As of 5 am, snow has started from Juneau and Hoonah southward with Angoon already seeing visibilities below 1 mile due to snow. Snow will continue to spread northward through the morning with visibilities steadily falling as snow rates increase. In addition outflow winds have been increasing steadily overnight. Downtown Juneau in particular has seen gusts to 70 mph already this morning. ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations of 9 to 14 inches. Winds gusting as high as 60 mph, especially in Downtown Juneau. Visibilities 1/4 mile or less are expected at times. * WHERE...City and Borough of Juneau. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult and is discouraged unless it is an emergency. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. High winds could cause tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The greatest snowfall rates and wind gusts will occur between noon today and this evening. Rain will begin to mix in late Monday night.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. People are urged to prepare their property before the onset of winter weather. For the latest road conditions, where available, call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
